pullRequest.body:
drive-by: convert some `convert` into `exact`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [e351e40d81](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16659/commits/e351e40d81666b76de7c81b851ae8e655e7f062d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/f2a44da5-3a06-41fb-bbd7-f63a7b7ca665) for commit 20e05ccc6eddf859cf5eebe858268f856a9cb14b.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Some of these `have`s and `convert`s were there to speed up compilation by changing the order of elaboration. Not sure if this is still relevant with current Lean.
!bench

If `!bench` succeeds and doesn't report slowdowns, then please go ahead and merge this PR. Thanks!
bors d+

:v: mo271 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

!bench

(trying again, it failed previously)
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5a976bd1-bf5f-4961-93b9-09805b7aa025) for commit e351e40d81666b76de7c81b851ae8e655e7f062d.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f875372a-2df6-426c-9018-ff9891db624e/to/5a976bd1-bf5f-4961-93b9-09805b7aa025) against commit b876d96d65bb1ce2738ec653b7f3b946734c6491.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10825246596/job/30033877444)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10825246596/job/30033877212)
Looks like an improvement to me.

I'm not sure all of those are necessarily big improvements, but they're at least not worse, and some are better.

maintainer merge
Looks like an improvement to me.

I'm not sure all of those are necessarily big improvements, but they're at least not worse, and some are better.

maintainer merge
Isn't the usual convention to indent proofs by two spaces?
good catch. (I hope auto-formatting is coming soon...)

```suggestion
  convert hasFTaylorSeriesUpToOn_pi (ùïú := ùïú) (œÜ := fun i x ‚Ü¶ Œ¶ x i); ext; rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove some unnecessary `have`s
